website_summaries.verdict: Franklin Hockey is known for making quality sticks, and this model is no exception – the one to choose for young goalies.
pros: A youth stick that is specifically designed for goalies
Comes in youth and junior sizes
cons: The blade feels a bit flimsy, but the stick still has an impressive build considering the price

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Great little practice stick for my 6-year old mites. They are using blue pucks and don't have big shots yet. So it will work for them. Stick is lightweight, seems fairly well constructed, and is red, so the kids like it. The paddle is a hard plastic that is somewhat flexible, but you can't put a curve on it. Maybe if I loaded it down with some books for a few days, I could curve it, but flat is fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. & L. F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be as expected
customer_reviews.text: Height, heft, and quality are what we expected for the price. Teen son is looking forward to using it! (Rec only, not competitive)
customer_reviews.author: KJS

customer_reviews.title: Great stick, but hard to curve
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built, solid stick. The only complaint is that the blade is not curve-able, like a traditional stick.
customer_reviews.author: NZ84

customer_reviews.title: Good stick for my kids to play around with in ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stick for my kids to play around with in the driveway. A bit heavy. I wouldn't recommend it if your kid is playing street hockey seriously.
customer_reviews.author: glovesoff11

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: A tad heavy for what it is but it's solid so I don't really have a suggestion on how to lighten it. Overall it works great and has held up really well. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Brave Sir Robin

customer_reviews.title: Good hockey stick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stick after our other initial goalie stick died after 2 months. This hockey stick is still holding up better than the initial and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good stick for playing indoors
customer_reviews.text: perfect for my basement ..good size not too heavy not too light..doesn't seem flimsy..i have not used it outside with a real hockey ball
customer_reviews.author: Al Stinkfoot Bundy

customer_reviews.title: NHL SX Comp 1000 Goalie Stick
customer_reviews.text: This is a good stick for a younger player or recreational use. I don't think I would recommend it for competetive ice-hockey but for the price it is great for everything else. It is durable. My son uses it all of the time and he is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to get bigger screws because the blade fell off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: When stick arrived it was plain white instead of the black which is pictured - very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C.

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our two boys Christmas, and so far they haven't broken like the ones we bought at Dick's.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old nephew loves this hockey stick and he says it's made well. He hasn't had it very long but it's still holding up to him and his friends (ab)use. From my view it's nice looking and pretty tough.
customer_reviews.author: Hide

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Toy
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT replace a real goalie stick for youth hockey, but it's perfect for the basement and playing around with my son. We needed something simple and cheap and this did the trick. If you are looking for something for real hockey, get a composite and spend a little more money as this is mostly plastic.
customer_reviews.author: KRISTOFFER FEATHERINGHAM

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: My boys love to play street hockey. It is a good goalie stick but may only last one season if played with regularly. It gets used at least 3x a week and has lasted 4 months but the first one we purchased only lasted a few months. For the price it's a good stick
customer_reviews.author: Hj

customer_reviews.title: The stick would be fine for street hockey which I suppose it was designed ...
customer_reviews.text: The stick is a little flimsy, more so than expected. My son uses it on outdoor rink with real puck. Although stick has not broke yet, it doesn't stop pucks that well. The stick would be fine for street hockey which I suppose it was designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent stick. Poor shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Stick is decent. But specifically asked for it to be gift wrapped due to it being a Christmas present. It came only in bubble wrap........yeah that didn’t work out as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Simetkosky

product_meta.title: Franklin Sports NHL Goalie Stick
feature_bullets: Features molded fiber-pattern blade textures, Assorted Colors
